channel.title: Why is a writer?
channel.description:
Produced by the Iowa School of the Air, this series focuses on various works of literature from Shakespeare to Twain.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Jonson in jail
item.description: This program focuses on playwright Ben Jonson.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: Theater & Drama

item.title: The writer for children
item.description: The Writer for Children, in this case, Robert Louis Stevenson, who was an adult yet was a still a child in the way he viewed the world.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: Stevenson, Robert Louis, 1850-1894

item.title: Undecided
item.description: This program, "The Undecided," focuses on Edgar Allan Poe.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: United States--Poetry

item.title: The Adventurer
item.description: This program focuses on Joseph Conrad, who wrote of adventures at sea.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: The literary cheat
item.description: This program, "The Literary Cheat," focuses on Thomas Chatterton, a brilliant young man who attempted to represent his forgeries as the work of a fifteenth-century priest. Chatterton died in 1770 at age 18.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: Religion

item.title: The hired pen
item.description: The Hired Pen, which deals with English history during King Charles II. The Hired Pen was John Dryden.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Gilbert and Sullivan
item.description: Gilbert and Sullivan, and the comedy operetta in 19th century England.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: Wit and humor

item.title: The secret press
item.description: This program is about the Secret Press, which was operated by a man who called himself Martin Marprelate. He produced pamphlets satirizing England's Queen Elizabeth I in 1588 and 1589.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: The Jungle
item.description: The Jungle, by Upton Sinclair, about social and health reform in the meat industry.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: U.S. Literature

item.title: Utopia
item.description: This program focuses on Utopia, by Sir Thomas More. The book is a critique of conditions in England in the fifteenth century.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: The frail lady
item.description: This program focuses on American poet Emily Dickinson.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: U.S. Literature

item.title: William Blake's vision
item.description: This program focuses on William Blake, who campaigned against conditions under which the poor children of England were reared in the 1790s.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Irving's old New York
item.description: This program, "Irving's Old New York," focuses on Washington Irving.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: U.S. Literature

item.title: The writer who thinks
item.description: This program, "The Writer Who Thinks", focuses on Jonathan Swift.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: Trials

item.title: The grand sacrifice
item.description: This program explores the reasons behind John Milton's decision to defend his political beliefs, although the choice meant almost certain total blindness.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: Poetry

item.title: Behind the humorist
item.description: Behind the Humorist, about the story of Mark Twain's double role in life: as writer and on a personal level.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: Wit and humor

item.title: Mark Twain on the Mississippi
item.description: This program focuses on the formative years of Samuel L. Clemens.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: U.S. Literature

item.title: Old Ironsides
item.description: Old Ironsides, written by Oliver Wendell Holmes, was a successful attempt to save the Revolutionary warship Constitution, which had been destined for scrap.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: War stories, American

item.title: Shakespeare or not, that is the question
item.description: This program examines whether William Shakespeare actually wrote the plays which are generally credited to him.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: Theater & Drama

item.title: Walt Whitman, the free American
item.description: This program focuses on American poet Walt Whitman.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: United States--Poetry

item.title: Critic of the king
item.description: This program focuses on English writer Leigh Hunt, also known as James Henry Leigh Hunt.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Beggar's opera
item.description: This program features a dramatization of the debut of The Beggar's Opera, written by Englishman John Gay, in 1728.
item.dc:creator: Walcoff, Larry
item.dc:subject: Satire, English
